name: (2E)-1,3-benzothiazol-2-yl[(4-chlorophenyl)hydrazono]ethanenitrile
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1084
Reason: 1,3-Benzothiazole base, with a melting point around 106 degrees Celsius, due to the presence of two phenyl groups, which would add approximately +20 degrees Celsius each, and one 4-chlorophenyl group, which would add approximately +10 degrees Celsius due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The hydrazono-thiadiazole conjugated system introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, further raising the melting point by about +70°C. The chlorine atom introduces a significant withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The thiadiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, further raising the melting point by about +70°C. The presence of two additional phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals forces. Each phenyl group may contribute around +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure.
